Name: The Successors
History: The Successor kingdoms were carved out from the short-lived Macedonian Empire built by Philip of Macedon and his son, Alexander the Great. The chief three kingdoms were Ptolomaic Egypt, the Seleucid Empire, and the Kingdom of Macedon. Together, they helped propel the Eastern Mediterranean and Middle East into the Hellenistic Age - a time of internecine warfare and technological and cultural advancement.
